Ad Text:
dnata, one of the world's largest air services providers, offering a wide range of ground handling, cargo, travel and flight catering services across five continents is excited to announce a new opportunity within our IT team.

We are seeking a skilled Data Analytics Engineer for a 6-month contract with an immediate start to support a maternity leave coverage! This role will bridge the gap between data engineering and data analytics.

This exciting, newly created role offers a unique opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies and contribute to data-driven decisions within dnata’s diverse operations.

You will be responsible for building data pipelines, optimising data models and developing scalable analytics solutions that support business growth and efficiency.

Key Responsibilities:

Data Pipeline & Infrastructure Development: Design, build and maintain efficient ETL/ELT data pipelines for analytics and reporting. Integrate and process data from various sources (APIs, databases, cloud storage, etc.). Optimise data workflows to ensure scalability, performance and reliability.
Data Modelling & Transformation: Develop and maintain data models that support business intelligence and analytics needs. Implement data transformation logic using tools like dbt, SQL and Python.Ensure data accuracy, consistency and security across analytics platforms.
Analytics & Visualization Support: Collaborate with analysts and business teams to provide well-structured datasets for reporting and analysis. Develop and optimise queries for BI tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Looker). Support real-time and batch data analytics processes.
Collaboration & Stakeholder Engagement: Work closely with data engineers to enhance data infrastructure and performance. Partner with analysts and business leaders to understand data requirements and deliver actionable insights. Ensure best practices in data governance and compliance (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA).
Performance Optimisation & Automation: Monitor and optimise data workflows for efficiency, scalability and cost-effectiveness. Automate data processing and reporting tasks to improve efficiency.

Essential Criteria:

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering or a related field
3+ years of experience in data engineering, analytics or BI development
Strong SQL skills for querying, data modelling and transformation
Experience with ETL/ELT tools like Apache Airflow, dbt or Talend
Hands-on experience with Python or Scala for data processing
Familiarity with cloud data platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) particularly Redshift, BigQuery or Snowflake
Experience working with data warehouses and data lakes
Knowledge of BI tools (Tableau, Power BI, Looker) and dashboard optimisation
Proficiency in O365 (Exchange, SharePoint, OneDrive, Teams)
Advanced use of SharePoint for data management and structure

Preferred Certifications & Qualifications:

Strong knowledge of data governance and compliance frameworks
Certifications in AWS, GCP, or Microsoft Azure for data analytics
Industry experience in Aviation, Warehouse/Logistics or Transportation
Experience with DevOps and working in AGILE teams
Experience in organisations undergoing digital transformation
Knowledge of Payroll, Finance, HR & Rostering Systems
Familiarity with Cargo and Aviation Systems
Experience working in global organisations with cross-functional local and regional teams

So... does this sound like you? If so, Apply Now!

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer, which values diversity and inclusion. We support applicants from all backgrounds including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders, people with disabilities, people from culturally diverse backgrounds and all ages. We also have a solid focus on gender balance within the organisation and encourage women to apply.

Staff / Lead Platform Engineer (ML & AI)


We are a growing team within the bank and constantly involved in industry changing solutions

You will be part of an innovative environment with likeminded individuals

Together we can place customers at the centre of what we do




Do work that matters:



The Fraud & Scams Analytics team, part of the Chief Data and Analytics Office, maintains the fraud detection and reporting functions for the Group. Our team supports the operations of Group Security who are devoted to protecting the monetary assets from fraud and financial loss of CBA and Bankwest customers.



As part of the Platform Engineering team, you'll contribute to strategic initiatives like improving the standards of Fraud & Scam Analytics, AI-powered engineering, and reliability uplift. You'll work alongside top collaborators to solve our customers' most complex data-centric problems.



See Yourself in our team:



This role blends Platform Engineering and Software Engineering with a strong AI mindset and AI Ops capabilities. You'll design, build, and evolve application, tooling, and automation that empower product teams to deliver customer value with speed, safety, and reliability. You'll also champion AI-powered engineering practices and embed intelligent automation into operations, observability, and service management.



Our team's diverse backgrounds means we can draw on one another's experience to deliver to best work outcomes. We are committed to safe-guarding our customers from financial fraud and scams. Our analytics run on Australia's largest real-time transaction monitoring system, handling millions of transactions per day.



We're interested in hearing from people who:



Have ML Engineering Skills


Experienced in design and implementation of scalable, end-to-end ML systems including data pipelines, model training infrastructure, and production serving platforms

Establish robust MLOps practices including automated model deployment pipelines, comprehensive monitoring and observability, A/B testing frameworks, and model performance tracking

Collaborate with data scientists, product teams, and infrastructure engineers to translate ML research into production systems.




AI & AIOps Enablement Skills


Embed AI-powered engineering tools (e.g., GitHub Copilot, autonomous agents, anomaly detection) into platform and reliability workflows

Leverage Gen AI and agentic frameworks to automate diagnostics, remediation, and service management

Drive adoption of AI tools across squads, aiming for 100% usage in FY26

Collaborate on initiatives like Gen AI chatbot and self-service analytics platforms




Can create Strategic Impact


Influence architecture and design decisions with a focus on operability, automation, and AI integration

Partner with squads to uplift DevSecOps maturity and reduce toil through intelligent automation, observability and CICD

Contribute to Frauds AI strategy and maturity curve, including ethical AI and multi-agent frameworks




Can take People Leadership & Chapter Responsibilities


Lead and mentor a chapter of engineers, fostering a culture of technical excellence, collaboration, and continuous learning

Provide coaching and career development support to chapter members, aligning individual growth with strategic goals

Facilitate cross-functional collaboration across squads, ensuring alignment on platform initiatives and engineering standards.
Represent the chapter in leadership forums, contributing to strategic planning and capability uplift

Promote psychological safety and inclusive practices within the chapter and broader engineering community




Tech Skills & Experience



We use a broad range of tools, languages, and frameworks. We don't expect you to know them all but experience or exposure with some of these (or equivalents) will set you up for success in this team;


Strong coding skills in Python, Go, or similar languages

Deep experience with AWS, CI/CD, ML and Infrastructure-as-Code

Proven track record in platform engineering, cloud infrastructure, and reliability practices

Familiarity with AI tools, frameworks, and AIOps platforms (e.g., anomaly detection, self-healing pipelines)

Experience with observability tools (e.g., Prometheus, Grafana) and incident management

Experience with Snowflake is desirable

Excellent collaboration and communication skills across technical and business domains




Working with us

Whether you're passionate about customer service, driven by data, or called by creativity, a career with CommBank is for you. Our people bring their diverse backgrounds and unique perspectives to build a respectful, inclusive, and flexible workplace with flexible work locations.



Here, you'll thrive. You'll be supported when faced with challenges and empowered to tackle new opportunities. We're hiring engineers from across all of Australia and have opened technology hubs in Melbourne and Perth. We really love working here, and we think you will too.



We support our people with the flexibility to balance where work is done with at least half their time each month connecting in office. We also have many other flexible working options available including changing start and finish times, part-time arrangements and job share to name a few. Talk to us about how these arrangements might work in the role you're interested in.



If this sounds like the role for you then we would love to hear from you. Apply today!


Whether you're passionate about customer service, driven by data, or called by creativity, a career here is for you.

Our people bring their diverse backgrounds and unique perspectives to build a respectful, inclusive and flexible workplace. We are working hard to build a team of people who represent the rich diversity of our customers and communities. If you're excited about this opportunity but you don't meet every single requirement, or your experience doesn't align perfectly, we still want to encourage you to apply. You may just be the perfect candidate for this opportunity or another within CommBank.

At CommBank we will inspire you with work that makes a difference, surround you with talented people that respect and value each other, and empower you to grow professionally and personally. Most of all, making a positive impact for customers, communities and each other is part of our every day.

We're determined to make a real difference for Australia's first peoples. We encourage all interested applicants to apply. If you're already part of the Commonwealth Bank Group (including Bankwest), you'll need to apply through Sidekick to submit a valid application. We're keen to support you with the next step in your career.

A forward-thinking AI consultancy is seeking a talented AI Engineer to join their Melbourne-based team. This is a unique opportunity to work at the forefront of generative AI and agentic automation, building intelligent systems that drive real impact across enterprise environments.




About the Role

As an AI Engineer, you’ll be instrumental in designing, developing, and deploying production-grade AI agents and applications. You’ll work with large language models, integrate them into enterprise systems, and build secure, scalable solutions that are both innovative and reliable.

This role sits within a collaborative, fast-paced engineering team that values autonomy, experimentation, and shared learning. You’ll be trusted to take ownership of your work while contributing to a culture of openness and curiosity. Ideas move quickly from prototype to production, and your contributions will be felt across ambitious client organisations.




Key Responsibilities

Develop and deploy AI-powered applications and agent-based systems

Integrate LLMs with enterprise data sources and APIs using orchestration frameworks

Implement observability, evaluation, and monitoring tools to ensure reliability and compliance

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define features and deliver incremental value

Prototype new capabilities and contribute to internal tooling and frameworks

Support DevOps practices including Terraform, CI/CD, and infrastructure-as-code




What We’re Looking For

Strong full-stack engineering experience with a track record of building complex applications

Proficiency in Python and modern front-end frameworks (e.g., React, TypeScript)

Hands-on experience with LLM and agent frameworks (e.g., LangGraph, ADK)

Solid understanding of cloud infrastructure and deployment practices (e.g., containerisation, serverless, Terraform)

Familiarity with agile methodologies and software architecture best practices




Bonus Skills

Experience with observability and evaluation tools for LLMs

Background in deploying and operating production-scale applications




How to Apply

If you're passionate about AI and excited to work on cutting-edge systems, we’d love to hear from you. Please submit your resume and a cover letter outlining your interest in AI technologies and any relevant projects or experiences.

Location: Sydney preferred (Hybrid) or Remote (Australia-based)
Type: Full-time | Permanent
Focus areas: NLP, unstructured text data, model integration, cybersecurity

Want to Use AI to Tackle Complex, Real-World Problems?

Join Avertro, a venture-backed cybersecurity startup building a platform that empowers security leaders to manage cyber risk with confidence. We’re on the lookout for an AI Engineer who’s passionate about extracting insight from unstructured data and shaping the future of intelligent, security software.

We’re solving one of the industry’s biggest challenges: turning raw security and business data into clarity for decision-makers. If you're looking to build real AI that goes beyond theory, and work at the intersection of NLP, data enrichment, and impactful product design, this could be the role for you.

✨ The Opportunity

As an AI Engineer at Avertro, you’ll lead efforts to transform unstructured data into meaningful intelligence. Your work will enable our platform to uncover patterns, extract key insights, and support decision-making in a domain where clarity saves time, money, and reputations. You’ll join us at a critical growth stage, where our platform is live with enterprise customers and extending AI functionality.

🧩 What You’ll Do

Design and implement robust text data processing pipelines

Apply cutting-edge NLP techniques to analyze, classify, and enrich unstructured data

Build pattern recognition models to identify trends and insights in textual data

Collaborate with software engineers to integrate AI models into our core product

Create documentation for models, algorithms, and data flows

Work closely with cybersecurity and product teams to shape features that solve real customer problems

🔍 What We’re Looking For

Experience developing text analysis and unstructured data processing solutions

Strong understanding of NLP, machine learning, and/or language model techniques

Ability to design efficient algorithms for data enrichment, entity extraction, or semantic analysis

Solid programming skills in Python (or similar), and familiarity with NLP libraries (e.g. spaCy, NLTK, Hugging Face)

Familarize with Retrieval Augmented Generative (RAG), LLM framework such as Langchain/Langgraph.

Strong collaboration skills and comfort working in a startup or agile environment

 Bonus Points

Experience integrating AI models into production software

Familiarity with cybersecurity or enterprise SaaS domains

Knowledge of knowledge graphs or metadata enrichment techniques

💥 Why You’ll Love Working With Us

Be part of a venture-backed startup solving one of cybersecurity’s biggest gaps

Join a collaborative, high-trust team that values autonomy and curiosity

Flexible working hours as long as you meet your commitments

Competitive package: salary and equity options 

Influence the product and strategic direction of the company as one of our early hires

Grow with us: Your career will progress in line with the company’s growth.

We offer team events and offsites and the potential to join our President’s club.

Our vibe? We get sh*t done, call it like it is, stay laser-focused on problems worth solving, obsess over our users, and work with good humans only.

✨ Interested?

If you love building scalable systems and want your work to have a real-world impact, we’d love to hear from you.

Please note:

We do not support visa sponsorship

Ensure your CV does not exceed 2 pages

Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

No agencies, please.

About the business:

Progress Rail Australia, a Caterpillar company, is one of the largest integrated and diversified suppliers of railroad and transit system products and services worldwide. Product technology, reliability and durability, along with legendary aftermarket parts and service support, have been our keys to success.

Progress Rail is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment. We value and embrace diversity of thought, background and unique experiences and we pride ourselves on an inclusive workforce and culture.




About the role:

The Locomotive Monitoring Center (LMC) Engineer is tasked with remotely monitoring and diagnosing locomotive issues using a variety of diagnostic and real-time monitoring tools. This role involves developing and providing recommended troubleshooting and repair work scopes.


Job tasks and responsibilities:

Works with various rail line services – both domestic and international – to remotely diagnose and troubleshoot locomotive issues

Remotely monitor locomotive fault codes and provide remote assistance with diagnosis and troubleshooting of mechanical and electrical systems of locomotives.

Create focused troubleshooting procedures based on issues observed while monitoring locomotives.

Communicate troubleshooting procedures to internal and external customers.

Utilise internal and external Remote Monitoring & Diagnostic (RM&D) or Predictive Maintenance tools such as IntelliTrain/Uptime, Locomotive Tracking System (LTS), and customers’ systems.

Coordinate and consult with a variety of departments, such as design engineering, reliability, field service and contract maintenance to gather information to address locomotive failures.

Work with data scientists to support the development of diagnostic and predictive maintenance models.

Participate in customer conference calls to provide daily troubleshooting feedback and monthly performance reports.


About you:

Prefer experience with EMD locomotives

Proficient with Microsoft Office software

Medium level of oral and written communications skills

Medium level of interpersonal skills to work effectively with customers and workforce

Strong analytical aptitude where problems are complex

Medium level of mechanical and electrical aptitude

Ability to read engineering drawings and electrical schematics

Knowledge of fundamental inspection, reliability procedures, and processes

Proficiency troubleshooting locomotive problems

Knowledge of locomotive shop practices

Willingness/ability to relocate as necessary

Ability to work as part of a multi shift seven (7) day a week operation

Knowledge of locomotive database information




What we offer:

Opportunities for growth and career development.

Access to mentoring programs.

8 weeks paid parental leave for primary carer at full pay following 12 months of service.

Novated leasing and discounts on selected health insurance funds, gyms, vehicles and more.

Travel Account for discounts on hotels, hire vehicles and flights.

Great work life balance.




About Our Process

At Progress Rail, we are committed to employing individuals who align with our Values and meet the requirements of the role. As part of the recruitment process, there are a number of checks which may be conducted for a role including police / criminal background checks, medical, drug and alcohol testing and/or reference checks.

If you are ready for a new opportunity and would like to join a growing team in a stable industry, please apply. 

We look forward to hearing from you.

Job Description: Systems Engineer
Company: Crossmuller
Location: Glendenning, Sydney, NSW
Department: Systems Integration

 

About Us:
Crossmuller Systems Integration is a multi-disciplined engineering leader specialising in the design, build, and integration of advanced industrial systems across various customers and industries. Our project-based work spans diverse sectors including Food and Beverage, Data Centres, Manufacturing, Recycling, and Warehouse Automation.

 

The Role:
We are seeking an experienced and motivated Systems Engineer to play a key role in the delivery of our projects. You will be responsible for the technical design, implementation, and commissioning of complex integration solutions. Your ability to understand the big picture while managing the technical details will be key to successfully interfacing with both our internal teams and our clients.

This role is ideal for a competent technical professional who excels in a project environment and is looking to grow their career, with a clear path towards technical leadership and mentorship opportunities.




Key Responsibilities:

·         Design, develop, and deploy integrated control systems, including PLC, SCADA, HMI, and industrial networking.

·         Architect and implement system solutions that meet client requirements, often involving integration with existing MES, ERP, and database applications.

·         Manage the technical aspects of projects, including system architecture design, specification writing, and code development.

·         Participation in commissioning activities, system troubleshooting, and providing client training.

·         Act as a technical point of contact for clients and collaborate effectively with other engineering departments to ensure seamless project execution.

·         Provide guidance and share knowledge with graduate engineers, contributing to the team's collective expertise.

 

About You:

·         You are an experienced engineer with a proven track record in systems integration within industrial environments.

·         You thrive in a project-based role where no two days are the same, and you enjoy the challenge of adapting to different technical requirements and scopes.

·         You are a confident problem-solver who can work autonomously to lead commissioning activities and interact directly with clients.

·         You have a strong understanding of how different systems (electrical, mechanical, IT) interact and are skilled at making them work together.

·         You possess strong communication and collaboration skills, and the ability to guide others is looked upon favourably as a key to future growth within our team.

 

Career Growth:
At Crossmuller, we are committed to the professional development of our staff. For the right candidate, this role offers a clear pathway for advancement. We value and will support your growth into technical leadership and mentorship positions, where you can take on greater responsibility for project deliverables and guide the next generation of engineers.

 

Essential Skills and Experience:

·         3+ years of experience in a similar systems integration, automation, or controls role.

·         Proven proficiency with industrial control platforms (e.g., Siemens TIA Portal, Rockwell Studio 5000/ControlLogix, Schneider EcoStruxure).

·         Strong experience with SCADA/HMI systems (e.g., Inductive Automation Ignition, Aveva System Platform, Aveva Citect/Plant SCADA, Siemens WinCC, Rockwell FactoryTalk View).

·         Solid understanding of industrial networking (switches, routers, VLANs, firewall configurations) and communication protocols (Modbus. BACnet, OPC UA, MQTT).

·         Experience in database integration (SQL) and higher-level programming languages (e.g., C#, Python) is highly regarded.

·         Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to produce clear technical documentation.

Eligibility Requirements:

·         A degree in Software, Mechatronic, Electrical, or a related engineering field.

·         Available to work full-time and willing to travel to client sites for commissioning as required.

·         Possess a valid driver's licence.

·         Australian Citizenship or Permanent Residency.

Job Description: Graduate Systems Engineer

Company: Crossmuller

Location: Glendenning, Sydney, NSW
Department: Systems Integration




About Us:
Crossmuller Systems Integration is a multi-disciplined engineering leader specialising in the design, build, and integration of advanced industrial systems across various customers and industries. Our project-based work spans diverse sectors including Food and Beverage, Data Centres, Manufacturing, Recycling, and Warehouse Automation.




The Role:

As a Graduate Systems Integrator, you will be immersed in the full project lifecycle of cutting-edge industrial systems. You will work alongside our senior engineers to design, develop, test, and commission integrated control solutions that form the backbone of modern industrial facilities. This role is designed to build your technical foundation and develop you into a well-rounded Systems Integration professional.

This is a fantastic opportunity for a passionate graduate to launch their career within a dedicated Systems Integration team, working on a variety of challenging projects from day one.




Key Responsibilities:

·         Assist in the design and development of industrial control systems using PLCs, SCADA, HMI, and MES platforms.

·         Support the configuration of network infrastructure for industrial applications (Ethernet/IP, Profinet, MODBUS, BACNET etc.)

·         Participate in software testing at our headquarters, and on-site commissioning at client facilities.

·         Collaborate with Project and Technical leads to deliver solutions.

·         Contribute to project documentation, including functional design specifications, test plans, and user manuals.

·         Gain exposure to a wide range of technologies, including industrial communication protocols, PLC languages, SCADA, MES, and Database systems.

About You:

·         You are a recent graduate (or in your final year) of a degree in Software, Mechatronic, Electrical, or Computer Systems Engineering.

·         You have a fundamental understanding of software development and control system concepts.

·         You are curious, proactive, and have a strong desire to learn new technologies and solve complex problems.

·         You possess excellent communication skills and enjoy working as part of a collaborative team.




Skills and Attributes:

·         A foundational knowledge of programming (e.g., Structured Text, Ladder Logic, Python, C#, or similar). Specific platforms are less important than core programming concepts.

·         Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications.

·         Excellent problem-solving and analytical abilities.

·         Strong attention to detail and a commitment to producing high-quality work.

·         Excellent time management and the ability to prioritise tasks effectively.




Eligibility Requirements:

·         A degree (or near completion) in a relevant engineering field.

·         Available to work full-time.

·         Possess a valid driver's licence.

·         Australian Citizenship or Permanent Residency (including New Zealand citizens).

We are HCLTech, one of the fastest-growing large tech companies in the world and home to 219,000+ people across 54 countries, supercharging progress through industry-leading capabilities centered around Digital, Engineering and Cloud.

The driving force behind that work, our people, are diverse, creative, and passionate, raising the bar for excellence on a regular basis. We, in turn, work hard to bring out the best in them as we strive to help them find their spark and become the best version of themselves that they can be.

Are you ready to be an important part of this ever-transformational journey?

At HCLTech Australia, we value the unique perspective and contributions of all individual and we actively encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people to apply for this role.

Key Responsibilities:

Strong design and development experience using broad range of Azure Services such as App Service, API Management, Azure Logic App, Azure Functions, Service Bus, Azure KeyVault, App Insights, Azure AD

Experience on Azure storage services such as Azure Storage, Azure SQL, Cosmos DB

Expert understanding of cloud computing, PaaS and cloud application design patterns

Deep expertise on Cloud and API/Services Oriented Architectures

Working knowledge on Azure DevOps

Experience in automation of solutions using Azure Resource Manager (ARM templates)

Good to have MS Azure certifications

Design, build and configure .Net based applications to meet business process and application requirements. Excellent knowledge of .Net Core programming concepts

Why Us

We are one of the fastest-growing large tech companies in the world, with offices in 50+ countries across the globe and 219,000 employees.

Our company is extremely diverse with 165 nationalities represented.

We offer the opportunity to work with colleagues across the globe.

We offer a virtual-first work environment, promoting a good work-life integration and real flexibility.

We offer comprehensive benefits for all employees.

We are a certified great place to work and a top employer in 17 countries, offering a positive work environment that values employee recognition and respect.

Equality & Opportunity for All

Representing 165 nationalities across the globe, we pride ourselves on being an equal opportunity employer, committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees regardless of race, religion, sex, color, age, national origin, pregnancy, sexual orientation, physical disability or genetic information, military or veteran status, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people or any other protected classification, in accordance with federal, state, and/or local law.

Candidate Data Privacy Notice | HCL Technologies

We are committed to respecting your privacy and for the protection of your personal data. Your personal data will be collected and processed in line with our candidate privacy notice: https://www.hcltech.com/candidate-privacy-notice. This privacy notice will help you to understand what personal data we collect about you, how we use this personal data, and what rights you have regarding your personal data.  By replying to this email or submitting any personal data to HCLTech, you acknowledge that you have read and understood the candidate privacy notice and  have  provided your consent to the processing of your data for recruitment purposes as described in the privacy notice”.

Senior BMS Controls Design Engineer

Location: Mulgrave, Melbourne
Join the Smart Building Revolution with Blue IoT

About the Role

We’re seeking an exceptional Senior BMS Controls Design Engineer to join our fast-growing Melbourne team. In this pivotal role, you’ll design, develop, and deliver advanced Building Management System (BMS) solutions that integrate seamlessly into existing infrastructure and drive the next generation of smart, efficient, and connected buildings.

Your deep expertise in Tridium Niagara and your passion for intelligent building automation will see you leading the design, programming, and implementation of large-scale BMS projects, both locally and globally. You’ll also play a central role in evolving our new AWS-powered, GenAI-enhanced Encompass Blue platform, redefining how buildings are managed, optimised, and experienced.

This position offers a unique opportunity to help shape the architecture of the next generation of Hybrid, AI-supervised BMS/EMS systems that will scale across the world.

Why Join Blue IoT?

At Blue IoT, you won’t just be another engineer, you’ll be part of a multi-award-winning Australian PropTech pioneer that’s redefining what’s possible in smart buildings, sustainability, and human wellbeing.

We’re not afraid to challenge the status quo. Our technology has already transformed facilities across education, healthcare, hospitality, and commercial sectors, achieving world-leading results in energy reduction, IAQ improvement, and occupant wellbeing.

As we scale our revolutionary Encompass Blue Mark II platform on AWS, we’re inviting brilliant engineers to join us in shaping a smarter, cleaner, and more connected planet. You’ll work alongside innovators, problem solvers, and disruptors who care deeply about the environment, people, and performance, and those who deliver impact that truly matters.

At Blue IoT, your career can grow in almost any direction. Whether your passion lies in product development, engineering management, applications design, or advanced cloud and AI innovation, you’ll have the freedom and support to explore, grow, and lead. We’re a company that recognises and rewards excellence, offering attractive financial incentives and career progression pathways as you help us pioneer the future of smart building technology.

If you want your work to make a measurable difference to people, to buildings, and to the planet, then this is where you belong.

Key Responsibilities

Design, program, and commission Tridium Niagara-based BMS systems for new and existing buildings.

Lead BMS and IoT integration to deliver intelligent automation, analytics, and connectivity.

Support pre-sales and solution development for new projects.

Create detailed point schedules, hardware selections, control strategies, and BMS panel layouts and complete documentation.

Develop IoT integrations using protocols such as BACnet, Modbus, MQTT, and LoRaWAN.

Collaborate with the software team to integrate AWS GenAI analytics and IoT dashboards.

Supervise contractors and ensure systems are delivered to the highest technical standards.

Migrate existing clients to our new Tridium/AWS ecosystem over the next 12 months.

Provide remote after-hours support for client emergencies (no site attendance required).

Perform maintenance, diagnostics, and continuous improvement to ensure peak system performance.

Skills & Experience

Minimum 5 years’ hands-on experience with Tridium Niagara BMS design, programming, and commissioning.

Strong understanding of BMS protocols (BACnet, Modbus, etc.) and complex HVAC systems.

Demonstrated capability with energy management, lighting control, and system integration.

Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and diagnostic skills.

Exceptional written and verbal communication (top 5 percentile).

Optional: experience with Node-RED or other IoT workflow tools.

Education

Bachelor’s degree in Electrical, Mechanical, or Building Systems Engineering, or equivalent experience (degree may be waived in exceptional cases).

The Ideal You

You’re not just technically brilliant, you’re curious, collaborative, and motivated by innovation. You thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced team environment, also work well autonomously, and deliver excellence with precision. You’re driven by the desire to make buildings smarter, healthier, and more sustainable, and to be part of something that genuinely matters.

Impeccable references in Australia are essential.

Ready to Shape the Future?

If you’re ready to join a visionary team that’s pushing the boundaries of smart building technology and sustainability, apply now and help us build the intelligent, connected world of tomorrow.
